required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vitamin D Supplementation on Outcome and Disease Activity.
clinical_study.official_title: Vitamin D Supplementation on Outcome and Disease Activity in Rheumatoid Arthritis Patients at Rajavithi Hospital : A Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: To study efficacy of Vitamin D on outcome and disease activity ; DAS28-ESR in Rheumatoid arthritis patients at Rajavithi hospital .

primary_outcome.measure: To study efficacy of vitamin D on disease activity RA patients at Rajavithi hospital
primary_outcome.description: Determine disease activity by DAS28-ESR in relation with vitamin D supplementation.

primary_outcome.measure: To study efficacy of vitamin D on IL-6 in RA patients at Rajavithi hospital

clinical_study.condition: Rheumatoid Arthritis, Vitamin D , Disease Activity, DAS28ESR

arm_group.description: First arm ; add on vitamin D 40,000 IU/week for 12 weeks

intervention.description: Randomized allocation first arm : add on vitamin D supplementation 40,000 iu/week for 12 weeks
Second arm : add on placebo for 12 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age > 18 yrs old
- RA diagnosed by ACR/EULAR 2010
- low to moderate disease activity
- on stable NSAIDs and DMARDs for at least 1 month
- Received Prednisolone less than or equal to 7.5 mg/day
- serum calcium, phosphorus and ALP are within normal limit.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronic kidney disease stage 3 or higher
- History of TB
- History of Chronic liver disease
- Pregnancy or breast-feeding
- adjustment of immuno-suppressive drugs, steroid
- other connective tissue disease
- Vitamin D allergy
- received other drugs which have vitamin D component
- serum Vitamin D less than 10 ng/mL

reference.citation: Polasik K, Piotrowska E, Lipi≈Ñska B, Witkowski JM, Bryl E, Tukaj S. Gopal K, Thevarajah M, Ng CM, Raja J. Effects of vitamin D on disease activity and serum interleukin-6 in rheumatoid arthritis. Int J Rheum Dis. 2019 May;22(5):834-841. doi: 10.1111/1756-185X.13484. Epub 2019 Feb 6.

Aslam MM, John P, Bhatti A, Jahangir S, Kamboh MI. Vitamin D as a Principal Factor in Mediating Rheumatoid Arthritis-Derived Immune Response. Biomed Res Int. 2019 May 7;2019:3494937. doi: 10.1155/2019/3494937. eCollection 2019. Review.
